reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights recently on a business trip to the area. The hotel appeared to be fairly new, was modern inside the rooms and lobby, clean, and well-maintained. The suite arrangement of the room was nice. Bathrooms were good. Beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: New, clean, and modern

reviews.text: This hotel is right next door to a DoubleTree and is not too far from the RDU airport (about 15 minutes or so). Most people probably don't care, but I couldn't find a good running route nearby so ended up running on sidewalks and the shoulders of busy roads.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Front Desk Issue

reviews.text: I was surprised at how much my company was paying for this property.
reviews.title: My second visit, that says it all!

reviews.text: Had a 4 day stay for Business.
reviews.title: Love a clean hotel.

reviews.text: Great place, nice rooms and staff.
reviews.title: Really great property

reviews.text: Stayed two nights. Overall experience was good. Waitress on duty at breakfast during the first morning was not very good, we had a much better experience on the second morning. Room service was not available in the evening. Spigot on bath tub leaked. No major problems and the motel was for the most part very nice.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Super clean - I believe this property is very new, as is the Doubletree right next door. Both are very well located in the Cary area if you have business nearby (anything within 10 miles is easily accessible in Raleigh, "traffic" here is not really "traffic"!!). There's plenty right next door, movie theater, restourants, shopping, fast food, etc......and it's right off the loop (lower side off 40 but right where the 440 loop begins).
reviews.title: Wish all hotels could be this nice.....!

reviews.text: Rooms, halls, common areas - ALL SUPER-CLEAN. Staff very friendly. HGI has it's staple small-restaurant in the lobby, did not use, but seemed clean and food smelled good.....tends to be a BIT on the pricey side, but compared to a full-service hotel it's not too bad.
reviews.title: Great Garden Inn!
Wow. Best Hilton Garden Inn I have stayed at.
reviews.text: Reasonable rates, clean-fresh linens, overall my new-go-to in the Raleigh area!

I was visiting friends in Apex, NC and was looking for a hotel close by. Since I like Garden Inn's, this was perfect. This is a newer one and the lobby looks great. Very open and I like the different colors used throughout the entire area. My room was a standard Garden Inn room but with updated furniture and features. Plenty of electrical outlets by the bed, which some older Garden Inns do not have. And I like that the newer hotels are going with just a shower in the bathroom. For some reason, bathtubs gross me out. Slept really good and grabbed breakfast in the morning. I've had some sub-par breakfasts at Garden Inns but this one was really good. Really fresh fruit, good eggs and even decent coffee. I didn't get the name of the woman working breakfast but she was bright and cheery and really took care of everyone.
reviews.title: Contemporary, comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, Cary, NC, on Thursday, January 10, 2013. I found the lobby and public areas to be very spacious. I liked the high ceilings. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. I found the staff to be very accomodating and interested in helping the guests.
reviews.title: Nice, clean property that is only one year old.

reviews.text: Large room, very comfortable and clean, with a great location next to shops, stores and restaurants. Staff is friendly and helpful. Room was quiet, even tho we were next to the elevator. Lobby is huge with lots of sofas and other seating. We will stay here again !
reviews.title: Clean, wonderfully located hotel

reviews.text: I'm a Diamond Club member. Hilton has made is so hard to "re-qualify" for 2014, I gave up. Why go from one Hilton to another to amass stays you can no longer hit.
reviews.title: This place is comfortable. Real comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I chose to just settle in here. Newer property. Great front desk staff and the important thing at the end of a long day, you can go down stairs and have dinner and a drink and go back up to do your emails.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: I will bring my wife here some weekend. Great location. Lots of near by restaurants.Cost no more than the Hampton Inn out by the air port. Try it. You will like it!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: I stayed with my family at this hotel for a month in October. The entire staff was great, and the accommodations were outstanding. I am a Diamond member, and travel frequently. I would recommend this property to anyone I know.
reviews.title: Outstanding all around!

reviews.text: The Hilton Garden Inn at Raleigh/Cary is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. My wife and I were there on four different occassions in 2012 and each stay was wonderful. The staff helped make our stays great. They were very, very friendly and helpful. The rooms were all very roomy and immaculate. The beds were very comfortable. The rates were very competitive with other hotels that offered less. There are several great places to eat and shop in the immediate area. The hotel restaurant serves great food also. I will continue to stay at the HGI when in the Raleigh area whenever I am in the area. I highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: There are plenty of places to eat nearby. I love new hotels and this one was new. After your initial check in, you can park around back which is near the back door and elevators. I travel a lot and highly recommend this location for a comfortable stay. Finding it at night was a little challenging but the GPS in my phone got me there just fine. Access to the interstate was great too. I rely a lot on Trip Advisor and it's funny, this is the first time I've ever reviewed anything. So, if you're surfing for a place to stay, you can stop now and just book a room here. You won't regret it.
reviews.title: New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time staying at this particular Hilton Garden Inn in the Raleigh area, in Cary. My husband and I were both pleased with our suite room, which had nice ammenities, lots of room, a comfortable sleep number bed, and having the extra space was nice since we were there for Christmas 2012..and had to sort through gifts, wrap presents etc. prior to visiting our family in Cary.
reviews.title: Top notch experience at this property

reviews.text: I am very particular about bed comfort..and so is my husband. I have been at other properties in which the sleep number beds are old and out dated. When I come upon this issue, I always speak up...because getting a decent sleep is important. Our king sized sleep number bed was quite comfortable set on the firm setting.
reviews.title: Comfortable
